popt4jlib.EA

Class DEA

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.EA.DEA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptimizerIntf

    public class DEA
extends java.lang.Object
implements OptimizerIntf
    A class implementing the Evolutionary Algorithm paradigm for function optimization. The implementation is a Distributed Evolutionary Algorithm by which a number of threads are spawned to compute at each iteration a new solution. The best of all solutions found becomes the starting point for each thread in the next iteration.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    • Constructor Detail

      • DEA

        public DEA()
        public constructor of a DEA OptimizerIntf. Assigns unique id among all DEA objects.

      • DEA

        public DEA(java.util.Hashtable params)
        public constructor of a DEA OptimizerIntf object. Assigns unique id among all DEA objects, and sets the appropriate parameters for the optimization process via the setParams(params) process. The parameters are discussed in the javadoc for the minimize(f) method.
        Parameters:
        params - Hashtable

      • DEA

        public DEA(java.util.Hashtable params,
   boolean setParamsOnlyFromSameThread)
        Constructor of a DEA object, that assigns a unique id plus the parameters passed into the argument. Also, it prevents other threads from modifying the parameters passed into this object if the second argument is true.
        Parameters:
        params - Hashtable
        setParamsOnlyFromSameThread - boolean

    • Method Detail

      • getParams

        public java.util.Hashtable getParams()
        return a copy of the parameters. Modifications to the returned object do not affect the original data member
        Returns:
        Hashtable

      • setParams

        public void setParams(java.util.Hashtable p)
               throws OptimizerException
        the optimization params are set to p
        Parameters:
        p - Hashtable
        Throws:
        OptimizerException - if another thread is concurrently running the minimize(f) method of this object. Note that unless the 2-arg constructor DEA(params, use_from_same_thread_only=true) is used to create this object, it is perfectly possible for one thread to call setParams(p), then another to setParams(p2) to some other param-set, and then the first thread to call minimize(f).

      • minimize

        public PairObjDouble minimize(FunctionIntf f)
                       throws OptimizerException
        The most important method of the class. Prior to calling this method, some parameters must have been set, either during construction of the object, or via a call to setParams(p). The parameters are as follows: <"dea.randomchromosomemaker", RandomChromosomeMakerIntf r> mandatory, the object responsible for implementing the interface that allows creating random initial chromosome objects. <"dea.movemaker", NewChromosomeMakerIntf movemaker> mandatory, the object responsible for implementing the interface that allows creating new chromosome Objects from an existing one (makes a move). <"dea.numiters", Integer niters> optional, the number of iterations each thread will go through in this evolutionary process run, default is 100. <"dea.sendrecvperiod",Integer period> optional, the number of generations before the threads communicate their best solution to the master DEA process and subsequent receipt of the same best solution by all threads. Default is 1. <"dea.numthreads", Integer nt> optional, the number of threads representing islands for this evolutionary process run. Default is 1. <"dea.c2amaker", Chromosome2ArgMakerIntf c2amaker> optional, an object implementing the Chromosome2ArgMakerIntf that transforms chromosome Objects used in the evolutionary process -and manipulated by the Object implementing the NewChromosomeMakerIntf interface- into argument Objects that can be passed into the FunctionIntf object that the process minimizes. Default is null, which results in the chromosome objects being passed "as-is" to the FunctionIntf object being minimized. The result is a PairObjDouble object that contains the best function arg. along with the minimum function value obtained by this argument (or null if the process fails to find any valid function argument).
        Specified by:
        minimize in interface OptimizerIntf
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf
        Returns:
        PairObjDouble an object that holds both the best value found by the DEA process run as well as the argmin -the argument that produced this best value.
        Throws:
        OptimizerException - if another thread is concurrently running the same method of this object or if the optimization process fails
